MECHANICAL DESIGNER

SUMMARY

I am a current Mechanical Designer for I.A.S.
I am extremely versatile, reliable and efficient with 15+ years' experience supporting managers, business owners and executives in high paced environments in a wide variety of professional positions.
Diversified skills include client relations, utilizing different design mediums, being hands on, project management, and working extremely well in both team environments and on my own.

EXPERIENCE


02/2016 to Current
Mechanical Designer
Company Name
— City , State
My primary responsibility is to ensure that Clients are thrilled through design, planning and implementation while making sure Interstate's services are the highest quality possible.
Maintain schedules thru interaction with clients and project managers, personnel and clients.
Maintain ongoing project requirements and specifications for multiple projects.
Review design efforts for team to ensure that quality is being maintained.
Manage and scope investigations into form or function of a feature or set of features in a design.
To create and refine technical and mechanical parts as well as assembly drawings to capture design intent and documentation.
Guide other Interstate Staff.

Lead Horticulturalist/Manager
Company Name
— City , State
Develop improved measurement techniques, soil conservation methods, soil sampling devices, or related technology.
Identify or classify species of insects or allied forms, such as mites or spiders.
Investigate soil problems and poor water quality to determine sources and effects.
Develop improved measurement techniques, soil conservation methods, soil sampling devices, or related technology.
Perform chemical analyses of the microorganism content of soils to determine microbial reactions or chemical mineralogical relationships to plant growth.
Tour work areas to observe work being done, to inspect crops, and to evaluate plant and soil conditions.
Apply pesticides and fertilizers to plants.
Hire employees, and train them in gardening techniques.
Select and purchase seeds, plant nutrients, disease control chemicals, and garden and lawn care equipment.
Explain and enforce safety regulations and policies.
Confer with horticultural personnel in order to plan facility renovations or additions.
Cut and prune trees, shrubs, flowers, and plants.
Construct structures and accessories such as greenhouses and benches.
Negotiate contracts such as those for land leases or tree purchases.

— City , State
Responsible for the overall design, development & testing (DDT): I design, draft, develop and test many concurrent product development and product improvement projects.
Design and ensure fit, form and functions are correct.
Perform calculations and work with vendors to develop production part design and allocate resources when necessary.
Work with engineers to address product updates and concerns and work with quality and customer service departments to identify product improvement opportunities.
Create and track ECN's (engineering changing notice), update drawings and documents, ensure they meet drafting standards, brainstorm ideas and modeling concepts, prototype new designs, and train manufacturing personnel on product design changes and upgrades.

— City , State
Responsibilities included maintaining and supervising all indoor and outdoor landscape needs.
This includes but is not limited to all budgeting, design, maintenance, horticultural practices for all on-site plants and oversight of all on-sight jobs.
Working with vendors and managing a cost-to-savings budget working toward a LEED certified campus and providing safety and cost solutions for Microsoft.
Establish and enforce operating procedures and work standards that will ensure adequate performance and personnel safety.
Train workers in tasks such as transplanting or pruning trees or shrubs, finishing cement, using equipment, or caring for turf.
Confer with other supervisors to coordinate work activities with those of other departments.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. Director of Creative and Brand - Photography - CUUP and Eloquii

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Management

Description:
FULLBEAUTY Brands™ is the premier fashion and lifestyle destination for the plus size customer. We are an online and catalog marketplace offering a curated collection of the finest family of plus size brands and thousands of products.
The Sr. Director of Creative and Brand mentors the creative team to ensure that all phases of the creative design process meet each brand’s expectations; this includes concept development, email layout and on figure/off figure photography direction, video & social media content. The Sr. director of creative and brand must be able to interpret and transform customer information into creative assets that emotionally connect with each brand while conveying product attributes while maintaining a highly elevated taste level. Experience in the luxury market preferred.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:• Manage the overall creative concepts for the brands utilizing customer research, brand positioning and input from VP of Creative & Design to develop innovative messages that clearly articulate the brand voice and product attributes to the customer.• communicate the teams creative vision to cross-functional partners• Work closely with the VP of Creative & Design to ensure the creative assets align to the collection strategies & requirements to drive sales.• Manage the brand creative teams to execute the creative concepts, layout designs and photography for omni channels in an innovative, modern way that is consistent and unique to the brand.• Strategize best practices for the entire creative team.• Design creative messaging for all digital initiatives including website updates, emails, social media banner ads, etc. with ability to interpret and transform brand positioning and print visuals into a digital platform.• Manages & works directly on all stages of planning and art direction of on figure/off figure photography in partnership with the senior creative manager, producer, copy writer & graphic designers. This includes talent selection, set selection and on-location shoot management in partnership with the photo production team.• Ensure the creative and product copy convey a cohesive message that will drive sales.• Lead the Photo Production teams to ensure proper follow-through of creative concept, talent selection, budget, and timeliness.•Responsible for maintain the total creative budget and aligning on yearly and quarterly goals with the VP of creative & design•Collaborate with brand marketing on presenting digital social content strategies to VP of Creative and Design.• Participate with design, marketing & merchandising teams to continue and enhance processes for the creative presentation of the brand.• Partner with Digital team on timely deliverables for online assets and paid marketing ads• Cultivate talent & mentor direct reports by further elevating their conceptual development, photography direction, design and creative copywriting skills – conduct timely coaching sessions to provide feedback regarding growth & development for next level opportunities• Clearly communicate expectations, and ensure the team has all tools needed to deliver on their responsibilities
  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:• Bachelor’s Degree (BA or BFA) is required.• 12+ years of experience in creating exceptional commercial creative content across design, photography, copy and creative management. Some prior editorial experience is a plus.• 10+ years of management experience building, leading and guiding creative teams.• Strong conceptual thinker with comprehensive experience in digital creative execution in DTC with high end experience.• Proficient in Desktop Publishing file formats in creative suite.• Hands-on experience directing digital on/off figure fashion photography with an editorial lense.• Excellent organization skills and attention to detail• An innovator who can identify need for, and develop, practical processes and solutions that facilitate organizational effectiveness and efficiency• Ability to work under tight deadlines and plan, organize and carry out multiple initiatives• Results-oriented, high-energy leader with the vision and management skills required to influence, direct and motivate both direct and indirect teams• Team-oriented, collaborative and has strong interpersonal relationship skills at all levels, including executive leadership, management and associates• Approaches their role with a high degree of honesty, loyalty and integrity and adheres to high ethical standards through leading by example• Ability to travel both domestically and internationally

FULLBEAUTY Brands™ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Director
<JD_END>
